primary_objective: Create a fully functional Windows 95 desktop interface in Next.js that serves as an alternate way to navigate the entire Remrin.ai website. This should be pixel-perfect Windows 95 aesthetic with working navigation, draggable windows, and full integration with existing routes.

components.description: Desktop component with icons and background
Bottom taskbar with Start menu and clock
System tray with icons and clock

icons.label: My Computer
icons.window_content: My Computer window showing drive list and stats

features: Each window can be dragged by title bar
Windows can be minimized (hide and show in taskbar)
Click window to bring to front (z-index)
Multiple windows can be open simultaneously
Window positions persist while page is open

draggable_windows.usage: Wrap each window in <Draggable> component with handle prop for title bar

shortcuts: Win key / Ctrl+Esc - Toggle Start menu
Delete - Move to Recycle Bin (if icon selected)

features: Text label with white text shadow
Window content loaded dynamically based on windowId
Click taskbar button to restore/focus window
Click item to navigate or open window
Closes when clicking outside or selecting item

content: System stats (optional): Total characters created, messages sent, etc.
Or: Show deleted items if you implement deletion
- Use Start menu for quick access
Tips: This is a nostalgic interface for the Remrin.ai platform...

sound_effects.implementation: Use HTML5 Audio, muted by default with toggle in Start menu

options: Just black screen with 'Click to continue'
screensaver.dismiss: Any mouse move or key press
